cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 105 mi E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to resume a slow west-northwest motion overnight, then turn northwest on Tuesday and northeast Wednesday night while paralleling the Florida east coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South Carolina (near Charleston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Golden Beach FL to Deerfield Beach FL (includes Port Everglades/Fort Lauderdale area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL (Tropical Storm Warning); Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida Atlantic coastline from Miami-Dade through Palm Beach Counties
weather_observation.wind: High chance (71%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; low (8%) chance of 50-kt winds. Gusty squalls possible Tuesday night–Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible along Broward County coast, including Port Everglades, if peak surge occurs at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated amounts up to 10 inches possible along the Florida peninsula, including Fort Lauderdale area, leading to flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible Tuesday; port‐side operations may also contend with prolonged swell and short-notice squalls.
